intro: Hieraciodes insularis, commonly known as the Socotra starlingweed, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small stars. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, aiding in water retention. Hieraciodes insularis is notable for its unique morphology and is of significant interest to botanists due to its endemic status.
